cards.name: Copy Artifact
cards.text: You may have Copy Artifact enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield, except it's an enchantment in addition to its other types.

rulings.text: The copy is both an artifact and an enchantment, so it is an artifact-enchantment (perhaps even an artifact-creature-enchantment). It can be affected by anything which affects either type of permanent.
The copy of the artifact is not still blue. It copies the color of the thing it is copying.
The artifact to copy is chosen at the time this card enters the battlefield. If there is no valid artifact to choose, then this card enters the battlefield as an enchantment that has no effect.

cards.originalText: You may have Copy Artifact enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield, except it's an enchantment in addition to its other types.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Drain Power
cards.text: Target player activates a mana ability of each land they control. Then that player loses all unspent mana and you add the mana lost this way.

rulings.text: This card forces the target player to draw mana from lands if they are untapped, but that player can choose how to draw the mana if a land they control has multiple mana abilities, or mana abilities with choices.
Your opponent may use instants and abilities of permanents in response to this spell before you get the mana from their mana pool and lands.
If a land can draw a variable amount of mana, the target player (not the player of this spell) chooses how much to draw.
A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

cards.originalText: Target player activates a mana ability of each land he or she controls, then empties his or her mana pool. Add mana to your mana pool equal to the type and amount emptied from that player's mana pool this way.

cards.name: Drowned
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drowned.
cards.flavor: We asked Captain Soll what became of the Serafina, but all he said was, "Ships that go down shouldn't come back up."
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Drowned.

cards.name: Energy Flux
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."
cards.originalText: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

cards.name: False Summoning
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.originalText: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Giant Tortoise
cards.text: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.
cards.originalText: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

cards.name: In the Eye of Chaos
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an instant spell, counter it unless that player pays {X}, where X is its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: This ability triggers when the spell is cast.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player casts an instant spell, counter it unless that player pays {X}, where X is its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood amongst the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Mystic Decree
cards.text: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.
cards.flavor:
"Curse Reveka, and curse her coddled conjurers. Their sorcerers' school shall yet be ours."
—Irini Sengir

rulings.text: This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.

cards.name: Owl Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Phantasmal Forces
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

cards.name: Power Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact's activated abilities cost {2} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the amount of mana an ability costs to activate to less than one mana.

rulings.text: Only affects the generic mana part of activation costs. Colored parts of mana costs are not affected.
Can be placed on artifacts with no or zero activation costs, but this has no effect on them. It does not increase the cost to one.
Can't reduce Snow mana costs.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact's activated abilities cost {2} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the amount of mana an ability costs to activate to less than one mana.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Reconstruction
cards.text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.
cards.originalText: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sea Serpent
cards.text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?
cards.originalText:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.

cards.name: Serendib Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a land. If you sacrifice an Island this way, Serendib Djinn deals 3 damage to you.
When you control no lands, sacrifice Serendib Djinn.

rulings.text: The sacrifice of the land is done during the resolution of the triggered ability. You also choose the land at that time.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a land. If you sacrifice an Island this way, Serendib Djinn deals 3 damage to you.
When you control no lands, sacrifice Serendib Djinn.

cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

cards.originalText: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Soldevi Machinist
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}. Spend this mana only to activate abilities of artifacts.

rulings.text: Mana from the ability can only be spent on activation costs for abilities from artifacts. It can't be spent on artifact spells, or on costs resulting from triggered abilities.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to activate abilities of artifacts.

cards.name: Stasis
cards.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

rulings.text: Since there is no untap step, Phasing in/out won't happen.
Does not prevent cards from being untapped outside the untap step.

cards.originalText:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

cards.name: Symbol of Unsummoning
cards.text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: ". . . inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude . . . ." —Kate Chopin, The Awakening
cards.originalText:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Talas Researcher
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.flavor:
From time, knowledge.
From knowledge, power.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.name: Theft of Dreams
cards.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor: Energy is never lost, only transformed.
cards.originalText: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.

cards.name: Thing from the Deep
cards.text: Whenever Thing from the Deep attacks, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an Island.
cards.flavor: Seafarers fear sailing off the world's edge not so much as down its gullet.
cards.originalText: Whenever Thing from the Deep attacks, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an Island.

cards.name: Transmute Artifact
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact. If you do, search your library for an artifact card. If that card's converted mana cost is less than or equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost, put it onto the battlefield. If it's greater, you may pay {X}, where X is the difference. If you do, put it onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Additional mana spent to cover the differences in mana costs is not part of the mana cost of this spell. It is spent during spell resolution.
The one from the library enters the battlefield when the spell is resolved, and this does not count as the casting of an artifact.
You can't sacrifice more than one artifact to this spell.
If the chosen artifact costs less than or the same as the sacrificed artifact, you simply put it onto the battlefield without paying any additional costs.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
The sacrifice of an artifact is an effect of the spell, not a cost, which means it happens as the spell resolves. If Transmute Artifact is countered, you do not have to sacrifice an artifact.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice an artifact. If you do, search your library for an artifact card. If that card's converted mana cost is less than or equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost, put it onto the battlefield. It it's greater, you may pay {X}, where X is the difference. If you do, put it onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.flavor: Unpredictable as the sea itself, water elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from white

cards.name: Cyclopean Mummy
cards.text: When Cyclopean Mummy dies, exile it.

rulings.text: The Mummy does go to the graveyard and trigger abilities which watch for something going to the graveyard. It then gets exiled as a triggered ability.
It does not get exiled if it goes to the graveyard from someplace other than the battlefield. This includes discarding from your hand or if the spell is countered.

cards.originalText: When Cyclopean Mummy is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, exile Cyclopean Mummy.

cards.name: Dakmor Plague
cards.text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.
cards.originalText: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Demonic Hordes
cards.text:
{T}: Destroy target land.
At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.
cards.flavor: Created to destroy Dominiaria, demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Destroy target land.
At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.

cards.name: Demonic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You pick a card on resolution.
You don't reveal the card to your opponent.
This card is put directly into your hand. It is not drawn.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Dread Reaper
cards.text:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

cards.name: Dread Wight
cards.text: At end of combat, put a paralyzation counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Dread Wight and tap those creatures. Each of those creatures doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as it has a paralyzation counter on it. Each of those creatures gains "{4}: Remove a paralyzation counter from this creature."
cards.originalText: At end of combat, put a paralyzation counter on all creatures blocking or blocked by Dread Wight and tap those creatures. They gain "If this creature has a paralyzation counter on it, it doesn't untap during its controller's untap step" and "{4}: Remove a paralyzation counter from this creature."

cards.name: Gate to Phyrexia
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target artifact. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"The warm rain of grease on my face immediately made it clear I had entered Phyrexia."
—Jarsyl, Diary
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target artifact. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

rulings.text: The extra mana is not considered part of the activation cost. It is a separate cost.
The additional mana is paid at the same time the spell/ability is cast/activated.
The extra mana is part of the total cost, so cost reducers can be applied to this cost.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

cards.name: Gravebind
cards.text:
Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.originalText:
Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Guardian Beast
cards.text: As long as Guardian Beast is untapped, noncreature artifacts you control can't be enchanted, they have indestructible, and other players can't gain control of them. This effect doesn't remove Auras already attached to those artifacts.

rulings.text: This does not stop sacrifices.

cards.originalText: As long as Guardian Beast is untapped, noncreature artifacts you control can't be enchanted, they're indestructible, and other players can't gain control of them. This effect doesn't remove Auras already attached to those artifacts.

cards.name: Hasran Ogress
cards.text: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.

rulings.text: You either take damage or pay the 2 mana during resolution.

cards.originalText: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Junún Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.

cards.name: Lich
cards.text:
As Lich enters the battlefield, you lose life equal to your life total.
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
Whenever you're dealt damage, sacrifice that many nontoken permanents. If you can't, you lose the game.
When Lich is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you lose the game.

rulings.text: If you have multiple Lich cards on the battlefield, you must sacrifice a permanent for each damage done to you for each Lich. This is because the sacrifice is a triggered ability. But you only draw one card for each life gained regardless of how many Liches you have. This is because the draw is a replacement effect and not a triggered one. You lose if any one of the Liches leaves the battlefield.
If you take more than one damage at a time, sacrifice the permanents for that damage simultaneously. This allows you to sacrifice both a creature and any Aura that is on it all at once.
You can't pay life, just like any player at less than one life can't pay life. You can pay zero life if you want.

If an opponent steals control of Lich and no other effect prevents you from losing with a life total of zero, you will lose the game due to a zero life total as a State-Based Action before you can take any actions. The last sentence doesn't apply in this case since the Lich didn't leave the battlefield.
If an opponent steals control of Lich, their life total does not change. The life total changes for a player only when it enters the battlefield under that player's control.
You can lose life and take damage, and thereby have a negative life total, while Lich is on the battlefield.

The last ability will cause you to lose the game even if you somehow manage to have a life total greater than 0 at the time the Lich leaves the battlefield or if some other effect would prevent you from losing for having 0 life. If, on the other hand, some effect such as that from Platinum Angel says that you can't lose the game then even the last ability of the Lich cannot cause you to do so. The ability will just resolve and the game will continue as normal.
Note that usually you will have 0 or less life at the time Lich leaves the battlefield causing you to lose as a State-Based Action before the last ability can even go on the stack.

The last ability will cause you to lose the game even if you somehow manage to have a life total greater than 0 at the time the Lich is put into the graveyard or if some other effect would prevent you from losing for having 0 life. If, on the other hand, some effect such as that from Platinum Angel says that you can't lose the game then even the last ability of the Lich cannot cause you to do so. The ability will just resolve and the game will continue as normal.

cards.originalText:
As Lich enters the battlefield, you lose life equal to your life total.
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
Whenever you're dealt damage, sacrifice that many nontoken permanents. If you can't, you lose the game.
When Lich is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you lose the game.

cards.name: Lim-Dûl's Cohort
cards.text: Whenever Lim-Dûl's Cohort blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature can't be regenerated this turn.
cards.originalText: Whenever Lim-Dûl's Cohort blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature can't be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Minion of Tevesh Szat
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Tevesh Szat deals 2 damage to you unless you pay {B}{B}.
{T}: Target creature gets +3/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"A minion given over to Tevesh Szat is a stronger minion gained."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Tevesh Szat deals 2 damage to you unless you pay {B}{B}.
{T}: Target creature gets +3/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Overwhelming Forces
cards.text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.

cards.name: Prowling Nightstalker
cards.text: Prowling Nightstalker can't be blocked except by black creatures.
cards.flavor: Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.
cards.originalText: Prowling Nightstalker can't be blocked except by black creatures.

cards.name: Rain of Daggers
cards.text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. You lose 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
cards.flavor: Knives in the sky, cries in the air, and blood on the ground.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. You lose 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

cards.name: Scavenging Ghoul
cards.text:
At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

rulings.text: The Ghoul still gets to claim counters even if it enters the battlefield after the creatures died.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature put into a graveyard from the battlefield this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

cards.name: Sinkhole
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Soul Shred
cards.text: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
cards.originalText: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

cards.name: Wicked Pact
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
cards.originalText: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.

cards.name: Word of Command
cards.text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. You control that player until Word of Command finishes resolving. The player plays that card if able. While doing so, the player can activate mana abilities only if they're from lands that player controls and only if mana they produce is spent to activate other mana abilities of lands the player controls and/or to play that card. If the chosen card is cast as a spell, you control the player while that spell is resolving.

rulings.text: To "play a card" is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.

You do get to choose which lands get tapped. You can make them choose an optional mana generating ability of the land that they tap, such as making them tap and sacrifice the land instead of just tap it.
Word of Command can't be used to force a player to play a card that isn't in their hand.

You control the player while this spell is resolving, which means you get to see anything they can see. If that player is required to search their library as part of playing the card or as part of its resolution if it's cast as a spell, then you can see the cards in that player's library as well.
Your opponent can't counter the Word of Command after letting you look at their hand, but they can attempt to counter the spell you force them to cast.
You may Command your opponent to play a land (if they have not already done so this turn).
You must order your opponent to play the chosen card if it is possible to do so.
If there is a non-mana way to cast a spell, as with Pitch Spells, you may require that way to be used if it is possible to do so.

Since this spell is an instant, your opponent gets a chance to respond to it as normal. Once this spell resolves, you look at your opponent's hand and choose a card. Note that it is common practice to respond to Word of Command by using up any spells or mana you have prior to letting it resolve.
During the resolution of this spell, that player plays the chosen card.

While controlling another player, you can see all cards in the game that player can see. This includes cards in that player's hand, face-down cards that player controls, and any cards in that player's library the player may look at.
Controlling a player doesn't allow you to look at that player's sideboard. If an effect instructs that player to choose a card from outside the game, you can't have that player choose any card.

cards.originalText: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. You control that player until Word of Command finishes resolving. The player plays that card if able. While doing so, the player can activate mana abilities only if they're from lands he or she controls and only if mana they produce is spent to activate other mana abilities of lands he or she controls and/or play that card. If the chosen card is cast as a spell, you control the player while that spell is resolving.

cards.name: Xenic Poltergeist
cards.text: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: Wears off at the beginning of the upkeep, not during upkeep.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Zombie Master
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."
cards.flavor: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.
cards.originalText:
Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk.
Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."

cards.name: Aladdin
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Aladdin.

rulings.text: Aladdin's ability can take control of more than one artifact, although only one each time the ability is used.
You do not lose control of the permanent if it stops being an artifact. The validity of the target is checked only on announcement and resolution of the ability.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Aladdin.

cards.name: Ali from Cairo
cards.text: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

rulings.text: This effect does not apply to effects which reduce your life without doing damage.

The ability works up until Ali enters the graveyard, so if he takes lethal damage or is destroyed at the same time you take damage, the ability helps you. If the damage occurs after it goes to the graveyard, however, it is not affected by the Ali which is no longer on the battlefield.

This effect does not prevent damage, it prevents the damage from turning into loss of life. So the full damage is dealt (and abilities that trigger on damage being dealt still trigger), but the full loss of life is not applied.

cards.originalText: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

cards.name: Artifact Blast
cards.text: Counter target artifact spell.
cards.flavor: The first line of defense against Urza and Mishra, the Artifact Blast achieved widespread fame until an unlucky mage discovered it was useless on the devices the brothers had already created.
cards.originalText: Counter target artifact spell.

cards.name: Atog
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Bird Maiden
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"Four things that never meet do here unite To shed my blood and to ravage my heart, A radiant brow and tresses that beguile And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Detonate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

rulings.text: If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.name: Devastation
cards.text: Destroy all creatures and lands.
cards.flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures and lands.

cards.name: Fire Imp
cards.text: When Fire Imp enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.originalText: When Fire Imp enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Fire Tempest
cards.text: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.originalText: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

rulings.text: For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its converted mana cost is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

cards.originalText:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

cards.name: Fork
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell, except that the copy is red. You may choose new targets for the copy.

rulings.text: When a spell with additional costs is copied, you don't have to pay those costs again.
For spells that can have a variable number of targets, the controller of the copy must use the same number of targets the original spell did.
Forking a spell with an X in the cost requires you to use the same X value.
Fork will not copy changes made by modifying effects to the spell prior to the use of Fork, such as text-changing effects.
If mana or other costs need to be spent at resolution of the spell, the player of Fork would still be responsible for paying that cost.
You need not (and may not) pay any additional mana or other costs (like sacrifices) to use the spell which is Forked. You get control over a complete copy but can change nothing except the targets.
Fork does not let you make non-targeting choices about the spell.

If the spell being copied targets a spell on the stack, it is possible to target Fork itself since Fork is still on the stack when you pick the target(s) for the copy. Note that the copy's target will be illegal when it resolves.
If you copy a spell for which Buyback has been paid, you get nothing back since the copied spell does not have a card to give you.
The copy that is placed on the stack is not considered to have been "cast".
The Fork card goes to the graveyard when it resolves and leaves the copy on the stack. There is no card representing the copy on the stack.

It does copy the mana symbols in the mana cost for the card it is copying, but it uses its own color definition and not the one from those mana symbols. This is so it maintains its color just like the text says.
If you Fork a Spliced spell, the spliced text is added during the announcement of the original spell, and therefore is fully copied by Fork.
The copy will have the same mana cost as the original spell, but will be red rather than whatever color that mana cost would have made it.
If the targeted spell was kicked, then the copy will be kicked as well. If the targeted spell was not kicked, then the copy will not be kicked.

cards.originalText: Copy target instant or sorcery spell, except that the copy is red. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Goblin Bully
cards.flavor: It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.

cards.flavor: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

cards.text:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +0/+2.

rulings.text: Works even if placed on one of your opponent's Mountains.
Works if enchanting a Snow-Covered Mountain.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land

cards.name: Goblin Firestarter
cards.text: Sacrifice Goblin Firestarter: It deals 1 damage to any target. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Goblin Firestarter: Goblin Firestarter deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.name: Goblin Warrens

cards.flavor:
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

rulings.text: The token Goblins can be sacrificed to the Warrens to generate new Goblins.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Gorilla War Cry
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat before blockers are declared.
All creatures gain menace until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's before the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText:
Cast Gorilla War Cry only during combat before blockers are declared.
Attacking creatures can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Last Chance
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
cards.originalText: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

cards.name: Lava Flow
cards.text: Destroy target creature or land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature or land.

cards.name: Mijae Djinn
cards.text: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.

rulings.text: The coin flip is done as a triggered ability on declaring the Djinn as an attacker.
If the Djinn attacks, but you lose the coin toss, then it is still considered to have attacked, and any other abilities that trigger on it attacking will resolve normally.
Any abilities which have already resolved before the coin flip are not undone. Any abilities that trigger when it attacks which have not already resolved will still resolve.

cards.originalText: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.

cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.

cards.name: Primitive Justice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may pay {1}{R} and/or {1}{G} any number of times.
Destroy target artifact. For each additional {1}{R} you paid, destroy another target artifact. For each additional {1}{G} you paid, destroy another target artifact, and you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Primitive Justice can't target the same artifact more than once.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Primitive Justice, you may pay {1}{R} and/or {1}{G} any number of times.

cards.name: Rock Hydra
cards.text:
Rock Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
For each 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, remove a +1/+1 counter from it and prevent that 1 damage.
{R}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Rock Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: If put onto the battlefield without casting it from your hand, X will be zero.
Once on the battlefield, the X is considered to be zero when calculating its mana cost.

You can activate the activated ability that prevents damage any time, even if no source seems likely to deal damage to you in the near future. It will prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt this turn, even if that turns out to be much later in the turn.
If damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra can't be prevented, you still remove a +1/+1 counter from it for each 1 damage dealt.

cards.originalText:
Rock Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
For each 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, remove a +1/+1 counter from it and prevent that 1 damage.
{R}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Rock Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Smoke
cards.text: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.

rulings.text: Animated lands are affected by this spell. If on the battlefield with an effect that limits the number of land you untap, untapping an animated land will count as the one creature and the one land you can untap... thereby limiting you to one thing to be untapped.

cards.originalText: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.
